docs.text: this is my first review that i post to this newsgroup , and i kind of feel like i have to say something negative about this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no one else seems to care that it takes certain liberties that should not be taken with a historical story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , even if one thinks of it as fiction , " the prince of egypt " remains shallow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but i'll begin from the beginning .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the biggest difference between the original , biblical story and this version is that moses has some semblance of divinity in the bible , whereas the animated version gives the impression of a reluctant hero .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe it's just me , but if i knew i had god on my side , i'd have a little bit more confidence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are other differences as well , such as a lack of important female characters and the passing over of the original pharoah's death like it's nothing but a thing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of all , though , the story's focus has shifted .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rather than being a story about father-son , man-ethnicity , man-god , " the prince of egypt " is almost solely about the brother-brother relationship between rameses and moses .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i was originally excited about this story element until i saw the movie , where it came off as maudlin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rameses and moses squabble like children and then , in the interests of peace , moses saves rameses' butt , even though moses was the one who started it . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: * yawn * i didn't care anymore by the time moses ran off for murdering an overseer ( which , of course , never happened in the original story - moses was exiled ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but enough about the differences .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: let's talk about the movie itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it features a moses who , in the interests of making the character more human , lacks any divinity whatsoever , which isn't convincing at all to anyone who knows who god is .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it features a cookie-cutter " i-wanna-please-dada " rameses , who at least is given dignity by the voicework of ralph fiennes ( from schindler's list , among other things ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film also features an extremely annoying character by way of the " new-improved " miriam , voiced by the ever-antsy sandra bullock , even though the most irritating thing about her is her tendency to burst into song for no apparent reason ( here bullock is replaced by a singing voice ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: speaking of which , it contains * very * annoying music .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it contains shallow writing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it features extraordinary animation , which is one good thing i can say about this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of all , it contains an attempt to commercialize , homogenize , and mass-market a story about a manifestation of god .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i am not christian , but i got the impression of blasphemy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the writers and producers took a butcher knife and chop-chopped into the story .
docs.label: negative
